statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: UT-Chattanooga 72, North Texas 56
article.story: CHATTANOOGA, Tenn. (AP) -- Alphonso Pugh came off the bench to score 20 points and grab 12 rebounds to lead Chattanooga to a 72-56 victory over North Texas on Wednesday night in the first round of the Dr Pepper Classic. The Mocs (6-2) will face Birmingham-Southern (6-4) in the championship game Thursday night. The Mean Green (6-4) will play Tennessee-Martin (3-7) in the consolation game. Steve Cherry scored 12 points and A.J. Mastin 10 for Chattanooga, which led 36-29 at the half. Leonard Hopkins scored 21 points for North Texas. Mastin hit a 3-pointer to give Chattanooga a 7-5 lead with 12:58 left in the first half, and the Mocs never lost the lead. The Mean Green pulled to within 36-31 early in the second half on a jumper by Michael Jones, but the Mocs used a 12-2 run to take a 45-33 lead with 13:56 to play. North Texas shot just 31.3 percent from the field, including hitting just 6 of 29 shots from 3-point range. The Mean Green also had 19 turnovers. The Mocs shot 44.1 percent from the field but also struggled from long range, making 3 of 18 attempts. They had 22 turnovers but a big advantage at the free-throw line, hitting 17 of 27 attempts to just 8 of 11 for North Texas.
